answers.answer: I was induced and had a big healthy baby (for the most part). My birth story along with some general info about inductions are in my journals on my profile. Feel free to message me with any questions.

I was. It was painful but wasn't so bad. I'd suggest trying to get up and move a bit and switching positions don't stay on your back. And breath through your contractions don't fight them. But mine took 7 hours with 15 mins of pushing so wasn't bad at all. I was 41+3
I want to be in the tub for the most part I just want him to come when he's ready so I'm trying the raspberry leaf tea tomorrow

I was induced and because of the wayy body reacts. To labor it was horrible. But if you can walk as much as you can and do what feels natural to you...im refusing to be induces this time around unless medically  necessary just because my previous labor was so intense and long

I was induced due to preeclampsia. When they broke my water I didn't dilate any further than 3, in a time span of 12 hours. So I had a c-section. The thought of being induced made me nervous as well, but you can do it. When you get to see your little one, it'll be all worth it (:Good luck momma
Being induced isn't bad they will just give you meds. To help uyour body start laybor off my mum was and took her 3 days for laybor to kick off after she was induced

question: So my due date is friday and my doctor said they will induce me if I'm a week late so I'm kinda freaking out I really do want to be induce
title: has anying one Been induced
